issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: Distributed shell app master should not release containers when shutdown if keep-container is true

comments.body: DS app master should handle shutdown request properly whether to clean up or not based on the attempt number check. Current behavior clean up all the running containers!

bq. DS app master should handle shutdown request properly whether to clean up or not based on the attempt number check.
This is not possible to do. The AM actually doesn't know what the last attempt-number is. See MAPREDUCE-5956 and YARN-2261 for background.

May be DS should (a) just never cleanup containers if the CLI flag {{keep_containers_across_application_attempts}} is true. (b) cleanup in shut-down hook like it does today if {{keep_containers_across_application_attempts}} is false.
Thanks [~vinodkv] and [~rohithsharma]. Attached patch which cleans up in shut-down hook only when keep_containers_across_application_attempts is enabled
